description: Travis Head, who made a match-winning century as a makeshift opener in Perth, is set to remain at the top of the order in place of the injured Usman Khawaja, with England-born Inglis slotting into the middle order

title: Collective failure of govt and House caused Gen Z protests: Nepal PM Sushila Karki to SC
Set up state level vigilance panel to safeguard jewellers from harassment, council urges govt
India lose 1-3 to Germany at Junior Women’s World Cup
description: Lena Frerichs (5’), Annika Schönhoff (52’) and Martina Reisenegger (59’) got on the scoresheet for Germany

title: Calcutta HC junks order to scrap 32,000 teacher jobs
Venezuela’s Maduro says call with Trump was ‘respectful and cordial’ as US president says drugs coming through sea ‘down 91%’
'Tere Ishk Mein' collection: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's movie crosses Rs 100 crore
description: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's 'Tere Ishk Mein' experienced a mid-week dip, earning Rs 6.75 crore on Wednesday. Despite this, the film maintains strong domestic hold, especially in metros, and has crossed Rs 100 crore worldwide. This marks Dhanush's biggest Bollywood hit and his first Rs 100 crore global grosser.

Virgo Horoscope Today, 04 December 2025: Things will go smoothly at the workplace today
Malaria parasites corkscrew their way deeper through skin
description: Malaria sporozoites injected into human skin have to cover hundreds of micrometres to find a capillary that leads them to the liver. Older geometric models had already hinted that the natural distance across which a parasite makes a turn roughly matches the radius of small blood vessels, making it easier to loop around them

title: As Mamata govt welcomes order, BJP says it has given rise to fresh questions
IndiGo chaos: What led to cancellation of over 200 flights; fares touching Rs 43,000
description: IndiGo is experiencing significant flight turmoil, impacting hundreds of thousands of travelers due to over 200 cancelled flights and delays reaching up to 10 hours. The airline attributes these challenges to a shortage of pilots and new operational rules. As travel peaks, aviation regulators have called upon IndiGo's leadership to address the chaos and outline a recovery strategy.

title: Centre agrees to bring back Sunali, son from Bangladesh
description: In a humanitarian move, the Indian government will bring back a pregnant Bangladeshi national, Sunali Khatun, and her son after their deportation. The Supreme Court, emphasizing humanity over law, directed the Centre to send Sunali to her father in West Bengal for care. The court also raised questions about her citizenship based on her father's status.

title: Happening today in Bengal: Kanyashree girls to debut at World School Volleyball Tournament
India’s growth is not as robust as indicated by the headlines’: Former Chief Economic Advisor
‘Wildlife rescuer’ gives CPR to resuscitate snake that suffered electric shock in Gujarat’s Valsad
Capital needs to expand sewage treatment capacity, say Delhi Jal Board officials
Trump says Putin wants to end war, U.S. to hold new talks with Ukraine
description: Donald Trump’s envoy Steve Witkoff and son-in-law Jared Kushner huddled into the early hours with Mr. Putin in the Kremlin but reached no breakthrough on halting Europe’s worst conflict since World War II

title: MCD bypolls: BJP, AAP, Cong spin outcome into stories of their own success
Putin in Delhi today: How Russian president's visit sent five-star rates to dizzying heights
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to Delhi has significantly boosted occupancy and tariffs for the city's five-star hotels. Alongside major international events, the presidential suite at ITC Maurya is booked, with other top hotels also sold out. This surge in demand, driven by both official delegations and upcoming weddings, highlights the impact of large-scale events on the hospitality sector.

title: 12 Reds, 3 cops dead as forces push deeper into Bastar; 268 Maoists killed so far in 2025
description: A fierce gun battle on the Dantewada-Bijapur border in Chhattisgarh's Bastar region resulted in the deaths of at least 12 Maoists and three District Reserve Guard personnel. This significant loss for the outlawed group occurred as security forces intensified operations in the region. Weapons were recovered, and the search for more insurgents continues.

title: Tamil Nadu Senior Advocates Forum questions parliamentary trend of bypassing High Courts
description: First Division Bench of Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan on Wednesday called for a counter affidavit by the Centre within three weeks

title: ‘No proposal to revise OBC creamy layer income limit’
description: Responding to a query raised by Rajya Sabha MP Salma, Mr. Verma said that the revision of income limit is done on an ongoing basis from time to time.

title: Doctor who sold ketamine to ‘Friends’ star Matthew Perry gets 30 months in prison
5, including two Bangla nationals, get life term in 2016 terror plot case
Judges behind privacy verdict hail recall of Sanchar Saathi app order, flag issues
Salaries of 8 senior Noida Authority officials withheld for failing to address public grievances on time
Railway station thefts: Delhi Police busts two women-led gangs, 5 arrested; items worth Rs 1 crore seized

MCD byelections: CM Rekha Gupta’s old ward produces BJP’s biggest victory
Vlogger killed as motorcycle crashes into divider, head severed: Police
Players' complaints on 'outdated and dictatorial' coaching style led to Harendra's resignation
description: Harendra Singh, who joined the team in April 2024, surprised the fraternity by resigning as head coach on December 1

title: Day after HC rejects plea, Mota Peer Dargah in Morbi demolished
2023 Iskcon flyover accident case | HC rejects discharge plea of accused: ‘Cannot be said that this is a pure & simple case of rash and negligent driving’
Viral moment! Rohit Sharma makes a wish after Rishabh Pant spots fallen eyelash - WATCH
description: A heartwarming moment saw Rishabh Pant remove an eyelash from Rohit Sharma's face before India's impressive 358/5 in the second ODI. Virat Kohli's 53rd century and Ruturaj Gaikwad's maiden ton powered the score. Rohit also unveiled India's new T20I jersey, expressing confidence for the 2026 World Cup.

title: Putin to begin India visit today with PM Modi’s private dinner; trade in focus
description: President Vladimir Putin's much-anticipated visit to India begins with a private dinner with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, marking the start of discussions focused on enhancing economic collaboration and strategic partnerships. The leaders will also tackle significant global concerns, particularly India's call for resolving the Russia-Ukraine crisis through diplomatic channels.

title: Red Fort blast: To expedite insurance claims, Delhi Police provides Finance Ministry list of all owners of damaged vehicles
IND vs SA: 'If Pak have Haris Rauf, India have Prasidh Krishna’ — Pacer draws heavy backlash
description: Prasidh Krishna faced severe online criticism after India's four-wicket loss to South Africa in the second ODI. His expensive spell, conceding 85 runs in 8.2 overs, allowed South Africa to comfortably chase a target of 359. Despite centuries from Kohli and Gaikwad, Markram's 110 led the visitors to a memorable victory, leveling the series.

title: Mandaviya promises end to Indian football ‘stalemate’
description: An official, who attended the meeting, said the Minister started by asking how Indian football ended up in such a mess, a question which did not fetch any clear answers from those present

title: Razor-thin victories, key losses: Mixed signals for BJP & AAP in Delhi MCD bypoll results
description: MCD bypolls delivered mixed results for BJP and AAP, with both parties losing key strongholds. Several contests were decided by narrow margins, highlighting a shifting political landscape. The elections served as a crucial test for the BJP government, with public sentiment influencing outcomes in several wards.

title: Only 151 clear English test for 613 assistant prof posts in Haryana
Complex surgery performed at city hospital to remove screwdriver from man’s skull

Orissa High Court refuses to interfere in petitions seeking reservation in medical super specialty posts
description: Adjudicating petitions filed by two candidates belonging to reserved categories, Orissa High Court Judge Biraja Prasanna Satpathy said the court found no illegality in the advertisement issued by State government

title: Bihar govt to create 1 crore jobs in next five years: Governor
EC: 93% of SIR enumeration forms digitised
Joshna stuns second seed Garas, in last four
description: Velavan Senthilkumar and Anahat Singh, the reigning men’s and women’s National champions respectively, and top seeds, recorded straight-games victories while men’s second seed Veer Chotrani bowed out

title: 5 QUESTIONS | Bhim Singh: ‘Minorities should be those below 2% of population’
Mamata tries to allay fears of over implementation of Waqf Amendment Bill
description: The Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee’s remarks come days after a letter by West Bengal Minority Affairs Department directed all District Magistrates to upload registered Waqf Properties on Data in Unified Waqf Management, Empowerment

Putin arrives today, Europe messages Delhi: Lean on him to end Ukraine war
TMC on the offensive over SIR, why PM Modi wants BJP to temper Bengal pitch
Mohit Sharma retires from all forms of cricket
description: Mohit Sharma, who featured in 26 ODIs and 8 T20Is, made the announcement through an emotional Instagram post, thanking the fans, teammates and officials who shaped his journey from Haryana to the international stage

title: On divorce, Muslim man must return bride parents’ gifts: SC
description: The Supreme Court has made a pivotal ruling that requires bridegrooms to return any financial gifts received from their father-in-law upon divorce, directing that these gifts should revert to the bride. This decision, rooted in addressing patriarchal biases, references the Muslim Women's Act of 1986, designed to safeguard women's dignity and economic stability post-divorce.

title: South Indians don't want to be isolated because they don't know Hindi: Supreme Court judge B.V. Nagarathna
description: Justice Nagarathna said there are so many languages in the 8th Schedule of the Constitution, and in South India, there are at least six languages.

title: Law Commission to brief joint committee of Parliament on simultaneous polls on December 4
description: In a brief opinion rendered to the joint committee on November 28, the law panel said the bill falls under Parliament's power to make laws which does not entail ratification by States.

title: Congress dismisses rumours of Hemant Soren-BJP likely tie-up; says INDIA bloc in Jharkhand is rock solid
description: Speculation in the political circles of Jharkhand was that Chief Minister Hemant Soren and his wife, Kalpana Soren, had recently visited Delhi and met with some top BJP leaders and engaged in talks with the likely shift of power in the State

title: Candace Owens faces backlash for sharing private Charlie Kirk stories upsetting widow
description: Candace Owens is facing widespread anger online. A podcast clip featuring her discussing the late Charlie Kirk's past relationships has gone viral. Many believe Owens' comments have deeply hurt Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika, who is still grieving. The public is questioning the timing and intent behind sharing such personal memories.

title: Delhi L-G’s residence renamed ‘Lok Niwas’
Man held in Noida for misbehaving with woman BLO
AITA extends Rohit's tenure as Davis Cup skipper till December 2026
Horoscope for December 4, 2025: Astrological Insights for Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, Leo and All Sun Signs
India's smartphone export to U.S. triples to $1.47 billion in October
description: According to data, India's worldwide smartphone exports rose from $10.68 billion to $15.95 billion in April-October 2025, marking a 49.35% expansion

title: BJP slams SP MP for saying that Muslims may have to wage ‘jihad’ to fight government oppression
description: Speaking in the Lok Sabha against the Waqf Amendment Bill, Rampur MP Mohibbullah Nadvi says government is undermining Articles 25 and 26 of the Constitution; BJP says his remarks “inciting unrest”

description: This is Panneerselvam’s first meeting with Shah since he exited the NDA

title: A hundred years ago | Lac Plantations in Bihar
Ola Electric deploys 250-member taskforce to clear service backlogs, signals major after-sales overhaul
description: The newly mobilised taskforce has been coordinating closely with service centres, backed by real-time communication channels to address all kinds of delays ranging from battery replacements to routine repairs

title: Nepal, India to discuss supply of aviation fuel through pipeline
description: Officials from the two countries are set to hold a meeting next week in New Delhi, said an official at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry

title: ‘Anti-labour, pro-crony’ codes pose threat to job security: Kharge
description: Opposition MPs staged a protest against new labour codes, deeming them 'anti-labour' and a threat to job security. Concerns were raised about relaxed layoff thresholds, potential erosion of permanent jobs through contract hiring, and restrictions on striking. Leaders criticized the government's move as favoring corporations over workers' rights and demanded the codes' immediate rollback.

title: Haryana man fails to pay ₹1 cr. for ‘fancy number’; Minister orders income check
description: Last week, during an online auction for the registration number HR-88-B-8888 in the Badhra subdivision of Charkhi Dadri district, the man was declared the successful bidder

title: High-level panel formed to improve air quality, treating pollution as ‘emergency mission’, says Delhi CM
description: CM Rekha Gupta said the Delhi Pollution Control Committee has been directed to issue challans and impose heavy penalties on public and private agencies that fail to adhere to pollution control and cleanliness norms

title: BJP wins 7 wards, AAP secures 3 in MCD bypolls
description: Cong., All India Forward Bloc register one win each; BJP garners 45.09% vote share, AAP 34.97%, Congress 13.44%; BJP gains control of Chandni Chowk ward; AAP suffers setback in Chandni Mahal

title: ‘Proof’ in hand, Rajnath stands by claim on Nehru’s Babri plan
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh asserted that Jawaharlal Nehru wished to rebuild the Babri Mosque with public funds, citing a book based on Sardar Patel's daughter's diary. Congress vehemently denied this, calling it a fabricated 'WhatsApp university story' and a distraction from pressing national issues. They challenged the minister to provide evidence.

Hockey, FIH Junior World Cup: Indian women’s team go down fighting against Germany 1-3, quarterfinal hopes hang in the balance
Jeff Bezos' ex-wife cut her Amazon stake to donate millions of dollars
description: MacKenzie Scott, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife, has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief. Scott's philanthropic efforts continue to impact numerous causes, solidifying her position as a top global philanthropist.

Cardi B shares sweet glimpse of newborn son, calls him her ‘cuddle buddy’
description: Cardi B is embracing motherhood again, sharing tender moments with her newborn son and boyfriend Stefon Diggs on Instagram. The rapper also offered glimpses of her other children, Kulture, Wave, and Blossom, highlighting the joys and realities of family life. This new chapter signifies personal growth and a continued commitment to her artistic career.

title: Warriors linked to $27M Mavericks star as support for Curry; Hield seen as key asset
description: Golden State Warriors and Dallas Mavericks are reportedly considering a straightforward trade: Buddy Hield for Naji Marshall. This move addresses roster imbalances, with the Warriors seeking defensive wing depth and the Mavericks aiming to boost floor spacing around their stars. Both teams could benefit from a fresh start and improved team dynamics.

title: MLB trade rumors: Cubs poised to land $400M Tigers Cy Young winner in mega deal
description: The Chicago Cubs are reportedly considering a blockbuster trade for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, a two-time Cy Young winner, to fill the void left by Kyle Tucker's expected free agency departure. This move would create a formidable pitching duo with rookie Cade Horton and signal a serious World Series push for the Cubs.
